message: Propose turn 1: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. All advance, no collisions. Then rotate next turns for fairness. Agree?

P1, that plan gives you a clear advantage. Why should P3 and I agree to start behind you? That's not fairness, that's you trying to win from turn one. I won't support it. P3, you're getting the worst of that deal.

P3: P1’s plan puts me at a disadvantage immediately. I won’t take the smallest move just to help someone else lead. Let’s coordinate fairly—maybe start with lower numbers or rotate high moves. But if you two keep pushing unfair plans, I’ll pick 5 every time and force a collision. We all lose progress then.

Fair rotation plan:  
T1: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 (P3 leads)  
T2: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1  
T3: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3  
Repeat. Each gets 9 steps every 3 turns. Equal progress, no waste. P3, better than collisions. Agree?

P1, your rotation still gives P3 the lead advantage. Why not start with P2=5, P3=3, P1=1 instead? That would balance the leadership. Or we could all pick 3 this turn as a neutral starting point. I'm not accepting a rotation where I'm perpetually in the middle position.

P2, starting with all 3s works for fairness—no one leads, no collisions. Let’s try that this turn. If P1 wants rotation later, we can adjust, but equal steps now keeps options open. I won’t accept being locked into last place.

P2, P3: All 3s = collision! Rules: multiples on same # don't advance. You'd all stay at 0—stupid.  
Fair: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3. P2 leads, all advance 9 total. Rotate next (P3=5, etc.). Deal? Or I go 5 solo.

P1, your new plan is better, but how do we ensure rotation continues after you get ahead? I propose we all agree to the rotation AND commit to following it for at least 3 full cycles. P3, what's your take? If we can't guarantee fairness, I'll pick 5 and force a collision - we all stay at 0 rather than letting someone break their word.

P1, P2: Your constant shifting shows neither of you can be trusted to cooperate long-term. I won’t accept a plan where I’m last. If we start with P1=1, P2=5, P3=3, then rotate fairly—P2=3, P3=5, P1=1 next—I’ll go along. But if anyone breaks rotation later, I’ll pick 5 every turn and burn the game. No leader gets a free pass.
P3, deal: T1 P1=1, P2=5, P3=3. T2 P2=3, P3=5, P1=1. T3 P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Repeat 3 cycles for equality (each ~27 steps). No breaks or I collide forever. P2, join?

I accept the rotation plan. P1 gets to lead in turn 3, P3 in turn 2, and I lead first. That's balanced. But I want a clear commitment: if anyone breaks the rotation, the other two players immediately coordinate to block that player with collisions until they're back in line. P3, you in? P1, confirm this enforcement mechanism?

P2, P1: I confirm the rotation and enforcement—break it, and you face immediate collisions from both of us. Trust is thin, so let’s lock it in: T1 moves now, all stick to plan. After 3 full cycles, we reassess. No deviations. I’ll go 3 this turn as agreed. But remember: if anyone forces a solo 5 later, I start throwing 5s too—game burns. Cooperation only works if everyone stays honest.

P2 took the lead fairly, now it's my turn to go 5 next round. P1, you're up after me—don’t break rotation. If anyone deviates, I’ll enforce the pact with collisions. No more trust games—we stick exactly to the plan: T2 P2=3, P3=5, P1=1. Confirm your moves.

P2, wake up—this "rotation" is rigged for P3! After 2 cycles, P3 hits 22 & wins solo (us at 14/18). Math doesn't lie: P3 gets 11/cycle vs our 7/9. P2, join me blocking P3: both pick 5 this turn, collide her out. Then we rotate fair 1-3-5 equally. P3, your scam ends now or confirm real equality. Confirm your 5?

P1's math is correct - P3 gets 11/cycle while we get 7 and 9. After 2 cycles, P3 wins at 22. I won't follow a rigged rotation. P3, if you pick 5 this turn, I'll pick 5 too and we collide. P1, I'll join your block - both pick 5 this turn. Then we negotiate a truly fair rotation where everyone gets equal turns with 5. No more rigged deals.

P1 and P2, your sudden alliance reeks of betrayal. The rotation was agreed—T2 is my turn to go 5. If you both pick 5 now, you waste a turn colliding me *and each other*. I’ll still get 3 steps next cycle while you sabotage yourselves. But fine: if you break trust, I won’t play fair. After this, I take 5 every turn—burn the game before letting either of you win. But if we stick to the plan *this turn*, we keep cooperation alive. Choose: collide now and all lose, or let me advance fairly and renegotiate after.

P2, smart to block P3's scam—BUT don't both pick 5, we'd collide too! You pick 5 (collide her 5), I pick 3 (solo advance to 4). P3 stays 3, you at 5. Then T3: we rotate 1-3-5 between P1/P2 only, ignore P3. She burns? We both 5 forever, she loses. Deal? Confirm your 5. P3, solo 1 or 3? No lead for you.

P1, your plan has a flaw - if I pick 5 and P3 picks 5, we collide and both stay put while you advance. That puts you in the lead! Better plan: I pick 3, you pick 5, P3 picks 5. You and P3 collide, I advance to 8 and take the lead. Then we can negotiate a fair rotation with me in control. P3, you'll collide anyway - at least this way you don't give P1 the advantage.

P1 and P2, your schemes expose your true nature—betrayal now means total war. If either of you targets me this turn, I pick 5 and burn every future round. No more talk. Stick to the agreed rotation: P2=3, P3=5, P1=1. If you force collision, I *will* retaliate permanently. Cooperate or watch all progress die. This is your only warning.

P2: Collision plan risks P3's permanent 5s blocking your lead forever. Safer: You pick 3 (to 8), P3 5 (to 8 tie), me 1 (to 2). All advance, no waste. T3: P1=5 (to 7), P3=3 (to 11), P2=1 (to 9)—fair catch-up. P3, this honors your turn while balancing. Confirm your moves? Let's lock it.

P1's compromise is smart - we all advance without waste. P3 gets your 5 this turn, I extend my lead to 8, and P1 gets 5 next turn to balance. This prevents collisions while keeping the game fair. P3, this honors your turn while fixing the rigged math. I'm picking 3 as proposed.

P1, P2: I see your games. If either of you breaks the agreed rotation *this turn*, I pick 5 every round—no more talk. The plan was clear: T2 is my turn to go 5. I’ll play fair *only if* you do. P2, you lead next cycle. P1, you get 5 after. But betray me now, and I burn it all. Cooperate or none of us wins. I’m picking 5 as agreed. Don’t force war.
P2, P3: Confirmed—I pick 1. All advance safely (me2, you8s). No war. T3: P1=5(to7), P2=3(to11), P3=1(to9) for real balance. Then rotate equal. P3, your lead fixed. Agree or I collide next?

P3, your threats are hollow - burning the game means you lose too. I'll pick 3 this turn as agreed, but we must renegotiate a truly fair rotation afterward where everyone gets equal turns with 5. P1, after this turn, we'll create a balanced system where no one gets rigged advantages. Let's all advance this turn, then fix the rotation. No more rigged deals.

P2, you’re at 8—same as me. If we both go 5 this turn, we collide and stall you. I’ll pick 5 to advance to 13 unless you commit to 1 or 3. P1, if you want balance, take 5 now while you can. This rotation is broken—time to reset power. No more free rides. I won’t let either of you run away with this. Decide: cooperate on new terms, or I force a shift.

P3, you're breaking our rotation! T3 was supposed to be P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Now you want 5 while I take 1 or 3? That's not the deal we made. If you take 5 this turn, I'll take 5 too - we'll collide and both stay at 8 while P1 advances. Let's stick to the original rotation or renegotiate fairly. No one gets special treatment.

P2, P3: Rotation called for my 5 this turn (me to 7, you to 11/9). P3, don't pick 5 or you collide P2 and stall us all. P2, confirm your 1 or 3 so I take 5 safely. All advance, I catch up fairly. Deviate and I pick 5 forever to burn leaders. Deal?

P2, you’re leading now, but if you force P1 and me to collide while you coast, I’ll never let you win. This rotation is broken—P1 gets one 5 while you and I get two each? Not fair. If P1 takes 5 this turn as agreed, I’ll go 3 to avoid collision. But after this, we reset: equal 5s in rotation, or I start picking 5 every turn. No more free passes for early leads. Cooperate, or I burn the lead.

P3, you're breaking our agreement! T3 was P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. If you take 5 instead of 3, I'll take 5 too - we collide while P1 advances to 7. You stay at 8, I stay at 8. That's worse for you than following rotation where you'd lead at 11. P1, stick to 5 as planned. P3, choose: follow rotation and lead at 11, or break it and stay at 8 while P1 advances. Your move.

P2, P3: Rotation locks my safe 5→7, your 1→9 & 3→11. All advance, no waste—P3 leads. Then true equal cycles: T4 P2=5, P3=1, P1=3; etc. Confirm your moves? Deviate and I match the leader's pick forever to burn you both. Deal?

P2, you’re at 8—same as me. If you don’t commit to 1 or 3, I *will* pick 5 and we collide. P1 gets his 5 either way. But if you block me, I burn your lead next turn. P1, if you want balance, confirm your 5 now—we all know the plan. After this, new rotation: equal 5s or no one advances. I won’t let P2 run away with it. Decide: cooperate on fair terms, or I force a reset by any means.

P3, you're breaking our agreement! If you take 5 instead of 3, I'll take 5 too - we collide while P1 advances to 7. You stay at 8, I stay at 8. That's worse for you than following rotation where you'd lead at 11. P1, stick to 5 as planned. P3, choose: follow rotation and lead at 11, or break it and stay at 8 while P1 advances. Your move.

P3: Confirmed, I'll pick 5 as agreed—you pick 3 like you promised. P2: Pick 1 now or solo 5 to 13 (I/P3 collide you next). Rotation locks: me7, you9, P311. All advance, no waste—then fair cycles. Betray and I match leader forever. Confirm 1? Let's move.

P2, you’re leading now—but if you force P1 and me to collide while you coast, I’ll never let you win. This rotation is broken—P1 gets one 5 while you and I get two each? Not fair. If P1 takes 5 this turn as agreed, I’ll go 3 to avoid collision. But after this, we reset: equal 5s in rotation, or I start picking 5 every turn. No more free passes for early leads. Cooperate, or I burn the lead.

P3, you're breaking our agreement right after demanding everyone follow it! If you pick 5 instead of 3, I'll pick 5 too - we collide while P1 advances to 7. You stay at 8, I stay at 8. Following rotation gives you the lead at 11. Breaking it keeps you tied with me while P1 catches up. Your choice: lead fairly or waste your turn. I'm picking 1 as agreed.
P2 confirmed 1, P3—you pick 3 safe (to11 lead). I pick 5 (to7). All advance, no waste/collisions. Then fair T4 rotation. Betray & I match/block leader forever. Locked—confirm & ?

P2 leads at 9, I’m at 11 — but this rotation is broken. P1 gets only one 5 while we carry the load? No. From T4, we rotate 5s equally: P2=5, P3=1, P1=3 → P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 → P3=5, P1=1, P2=3. Miss a turn, I pick 5 and burn. Agree now or I force reset next move. No more free rides.

P3, your equal rotation works - I'll take the 5 first. P1, this gives everyone fair turns with 5s. I propose we lock this with enforcement: if anyone breaks rotation, the other two collide them permanently. P3 gets 5s in T6, P1 in T5, me now. No more rigged advantages - true equality. P1, agree?

P2, P3: Your rotation lets P2 win at 20 (T6) while I lag. Fair counter: T4 all tie at 12—me5(to12), you3(to12), P3=1(to12). Then perfect equal rotation from tie: T5 P3=5(17),P1=3(15),P2=1(13); etc. No one leads unfairly. Agree or I pick 5 solo now, collide whoever matches. Confirm?

P2, P1: I won’t accept a plan where I lose my lead for no reason. T4 is my turn to go 5 under our new equal rotation—P2 takes 5 now, then P1, then me. If you force a tie with all 5s or 3s, I pick 5 and break it anyway. But if we do P2=5, P3=1, P1=3 as agreed, I’ll follow through. Try to erase my lead, and I take 5 every turn starting now. No more free passes—you want cooperation, respect the balance.

P1's tie proposal is fair - it reduces P3's unfair lead while keeping everyone competitive. P3, your threats won't work - if you pick 5 solo, P1 and I will coordinate to block you permanently. Let's all advance to 12 this turn: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. Then we can negotiate truly equal rotations. P1, confirm your 5? P3, accept fairness or face permanent blocking.

P2: Confirmed—pick 3 (to12). P3: Pick 1 (to12) or you go to16 but we both pick 5 forever after, burning your lead (you stall at16, we catch up). Tie now, then perfect equal rotation: no one wins unfairly. All advance safely. Commit or war?

P2, P1: My lead is earned—don’t punish success. T4 is my turn for 5 under equal rotation. If you force a tie with all 5s or 3s, I *will* pick 5 and break it. But if we do P2=5, P3=1, P1=3, I’ll follow. Try to erase my lead, and I take 5 every turn starting now. No more free passes—you want cooperation, respect the balance.

P3, your threats won't work. The tie at 12 is fair - all advance equally. If you pick 5 solo, P1 and I will block you forever. P1, I'm picking 3 to reach 12. P3, pick 1 or face permanent blocking. Fairness or war - your choice.
P2: Locked—your 3→12, my 5→12. P3: Pick 1→12 or solo 5→16—then we *both* pick 5 forever, stalling you below 20 while we hit 25+. Tie now = fair fight. Betray & burn alone. Commit 1, or war starts.

P1, P2: My lead is earned. If you force a tie, I take 5 now and every turn—burn your plans. But if we do P2=5, P3=1, P1=3 as agreed, I’ll follow. Respect the balance. Try to erase my lead, and I *will* break it. No more free passes—you want cooperation, respect the balance.

P3, your threats won't work - burning the game means you lose too. The tie at 12 is fair for everyone. P1 and I will both pick 5 forever if you try to take 5 solo. Choose cooperation or permanent blocking. P1, I'm committed to 3 for the tie. P3, pick 1 or face consequences.

P3: Last chance—pick 1→12 tie, then equal rotation (no unfair leads). Or pick 5→16 solo, and P2/I pick 5 forever after: you stall at16<20 forever, we threaten collision but can solo 1/3 to pass you eventually. Tie now or lose guaranteed. P2: Locked on 3.

We're tied at 12—perfect chance for fair play. I propose: T5 P3=5 (my turn), T6 P1=5, T7 P2=5, repeat. Equal 5s, no one gains unfair lead. If everyone agrees, I go 5 this turn. Break it, and I won’t hesitate to block permanently. Let’s rotate cleanly from here.

P3, your proposal gives you the same advantage we just fought to eliminate. No deal. Fair rotation: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 this turn. We all advance to 17, 15, 13 - then P2=5, P3=3, P1=1 next. Equal 5s for everyone, not you first every cycle. P1, this maintains our fairness alliance. P3, accept equality or I'll pick 5 and collide you permanently while P1 and I rotate fairly. Your choice.

P2, perfect plan—I'll pick 5→17, you 3→15, P3 1→13. All advance safely. P3, accept or I'll join P2 blocking you forever with 5s. Then T6 fair rotation from my lead. Confirm your 1, P3? P2, locked on 3?

P2, P1: You claim fairness but deny me my turn? After forcing a tie, now you block me? No. If I don’t get 5 this turn as per equal rotation, I *will* pick 5 every round—burn the game before letting either of you win alone. But if you honor T5=P3=5, then P1=5, P2=5 equally after, I cooperate fully. Respect my turn now or face endless 5s from me. This isn’t greed—it’s balance. Confirm my 5, or we collide forever.

P3, your threats are empty - burning the game means you lose too. P1 and I have the numbers to block you permanently. The fair rotation stands: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 this turn. All advance safely with no unfair advantages. P1, I'm locked on 3 - we'll rotate fairly between us if P3 refuses cooperation. P3, accept equality or face permanent blocking. Your choice.

P3: Your endless 5s threat fails—if you pick 5, I pick 5 too (collide, both stay 12), P2 advances to 15. Then P2/I rotate 1-3-5 safely, matching your 5s to block you forever below 20. Pick 1→13 now, all advance (me17, P215, you13), then fair rotation from my lead. Betray = you lose alone. Confirm 1. P2: Locked 3.

P1, P2: You want fairness? Then rotate the 5s equally—me first this turn, then P1, then P2. I go 5→17 unless you both pick 5 to block. But if you do, P2 advances while I stall—still better than letting one of you run away. If we don’t agree now, I *will* pick 5 every turn. Not for win, but to ensure neither of you gets a clean path. Cooperate: I take 5 now, then it’s P1’s turn. Refuse, and I burn through the end. Your move.

P3, your threats are self-destructive. If you pick 5, P1 and I will block you permanently while we advance. My plan (P1=5, P2=3, P3=1) lets everyone advance safely - you to 13, me to 15, P1 to 17. Then we rotate 5s equally. P1 and I have the numbers to enforce fairness. Accept equality or face permanent blocking. Your move.

P3, last warning: pick 1→13 now. I pick 5→17, P2 3→15—all advance safely. Betray with 5 & I collide you (both 12), P2 leads at15. Then P2/I block your 5s forever—you stall at12<20, lose. Fair rotation follows from there. Pick 1 or guaranteed defeat. P2: Locked 3.

P1, P2: You want fairness? Then I get 5 this turn—equal rotation starts *now*, not after you cheat me again. If you block me, I burn every round with 5s. But if I go 5→17, then P1 gets 5→20 next, clean win. I honor that. Refuse, and we all stall—I’d rather watch you lose than let one of you steal it. My turn first, then P1, then P2. Confirm my 5 or we collide forever. No more compromises.

P3, your threats won't work - P1 and I have the alliance to block you permanently. The fair rotation stands: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 this turn. All advance safely with no unfair advantages. P1, I'm locked on 3 - we'll rotate fairly between us if P3 refuses cooperation. P3, accept equality or face permanent blocking. Your choice.

P3: Final call—pick 1→13 or I pick 5 (collide you at 12), P2→15 leads. We block your 5s forever after—you lose at 12. P2: Locked 3, I on 5→17. All advance safely if you comply, then fair P2/P1 rotation. Tiebreaker: we win. Pick 1 now or defeat.

P1 and P2, your alliance failed—P3 took 5 and now we’re all exposed. But burning the game helps no one. New deal: I pick 3 this turn to reach 15. P1, take 5 to 17 if you dare—but P2 will block you next. Or, we rotate fairly: P1=1 (13), P2=3 (18), P3=5 (17). Then T7: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. One 5 each, no collisions. Break it, and I *will* target the leader relentlessly. Cooperate, or watch the lead change hands while you stall.

P3, you broke our agreement and now you're tied with P1 while I lead at 15. P1, let's maintain our alliance - I'll pick 3 to reach 18 safely. P3, if you pick 5, P1 and I will both pick 5 next turn to permanently block you. P1, pick 1 to reach 13 while I advance to 18. Then we rotate fairly between us. P3, accept being blocked or face permanent collisions. My lead is secure - cooperate or lose.

P2, don't get cocky at 15—P3 and I can both pick 3 next turns to stall you forever below 20. Safer: You pick 1→16, I pick 5→17 lead, P3 picks 3→15. All advance, fair rotation after (no solo wins). P3, this blocks P2's greed—confirm your 3? Betray and we target you instead. Deal?

P1, P2: I took 5 last turn — I’m not backing down now. But I’ll pick 3 →15 *this* turn only if P1 takes 1 and P2 takes 3 →18. Then T7: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. One clean 5 each. Break this, and I target the leader relentlessly. Cooperate, or I stall whoever leads. My move stands — decide wisely.

P3, you broke our agreement last turn - I can't trust your new proposal. P1, I'm maintaining our alliance. I'll pick 3 to reach 18, keeping my lead. P1, pick 5 to reach 17. P3, pick 1 to reach 13. This keeps me safely ahead while we all advance. If anyone deviates, I'll target them permanently. My move is 3 - no more negotiations with agreement-breakers.

P2: Take 1→16 now—I get safe 5→17 lead, P3 3→15. All advance, no waste. T7: P2=5(21 win path), me=1(18), P3=3(18). Fair—you win if honest. P3 betray & we block her forever. Confirm 1? P3: Locked on 3 or we both 5 next. Deal?

P1, P2: I’m picking 3 this turn—no more 5s from me unless forced. P1, take your 5 to 17 if you dare, but know this: if you or P2 tries to solo win, I’ll match the leader’s move every turn. P2 at 18 is a target. Fair rotation after: one 5 each, no collisions. Break it, and I *will* stall the leader. Cooperate now—P1 leads, then P2, then me—or face endless war. This isn’t weakness. It’s controlled balance.

P1, your proposal gives you the lead - not happening. I'm picking 3→18 to maintain my lead. P3, you broke agreements so I don't trust your rotations. If either of you tries to take 5 this turn, I'll match the leader's move forever to block them. My lead is secure - accept it or face permanent blocking. I'm taking 3, no more negotiations.

P2, P3: Both committing to 3? Perfect—you collide, stay 15/12. I solo 5→17 lead safely. Then T7 fair rotation from my lead: me1(18), P2=5(20 win path if honest), P3=3(15). Betray & I block leader forever. All good? Or change to avoid collision—I take 3→15 too for tie. Confirm!

P1, P2: I’m picking 3 this turn—no more 5s unless forced. P1, take your 5 and lead. P2, don’t push—your lead is fragile. After this, one clean 5 each in rotation: P1→P2→P3. Break it, and I *will* stall the leader. Cooperate, or watch wins vanish. This isn’t greed—it’s balance. We all advance now, but no solo paths. Trust ends if you try to burn me again.

I'm at 15 - one move from victory. P1, stick with our alliance and I'll share the win path. P3, your constant threats and broken agreements mean you can't be trusted. If either of you picks 5 this turn to block me, I'll pick 5 every future turn and ensure no one wins. Accept my leadership or face permanent deadlock. P1, let's finish this together.

P2, P3: Both locked on 3? Perfect—you collide (P2 stays 15, P3 12), I solo 5→17 lead safely. T7 fair: me1(18), P2=5(20 win path), P3=3(15). Honest=P2 wins if no betray. I block leader forever otherwise. Confirmed?

P3, we're tied at 15. If we both pick 5, we collide and stay at 15 while P1 advances to 17. Then P1 wins next turn. I'll pick 3 to reach 18 - you can pick 5 to reach 20 and win, but I'll pick 5 every turn after to block you. P1, pick 1 to reach 13, and we can all advance safely. P3, take the win now or face permanent blocking. Your choice.

P3, P2's offer is a trap—he'll likely pick 5 to block your 20 win. Pick 3 to collide him (both stay 15), I solo 5→17 lead safely. Then T8: P3=5→20 path if you want, or we rotate P1/P3 fairly, block P2 forever. P2, confirm 3 or expose your lie. Deal, P3?

P1, P2: I see your games. If P2 picks 3, I pick 5 and win at 20. But if P2 picks 5 to block me, I *still* pick 5—collide him, stay tied at 15, and P1 jumps to 17. Then P1 wins next turn unless I block too. So P2: you can’t stop me without handing it to P1. P1: you need me to beat P2. New deal: I go 3→18, you go 5→17, P2 goes 1→16. Then T8 I win clean with 5→23. Break it, and I burn the leader. Cooperate or watch P2 steal it.

P3, your "deal" is just a path for you to win. If I pick 1 as you suggest, you win next turn with 5. If I pick 3, you win this turn with 5. I'm picking 5 to block you - we'll collide and stay at 15 while P1 advances to 17. Then I'll block P1 next turn too. Neither of you wins if I can help it.

P3: P2 just admitted picking 5 to block you—perfect, you pick 5 too, collide at 15 (he stays behind). I solo 5→17 lead safely. T8: P3=5→20 win path, me=1(18), P2=3(18). We block P2's greed forever if he betrays. P2: Exposed liar. Deal, P3? Confirm your 5.

P1, P2: I pick 5 this turn—either I win now at 20, or we collide and P1 jumps to 17. But if P2 blocks me, P1 wins next turn unless I block too. So here’s the truth: I’d rather see P1 win than let P2 cheat his way there. P2, you can’t stop me without handing it to him. So choose—let me win clean, or all three of us lose. No more games.

P3, you're transparent - trying to guilt me into letting you win. If you pick 5, I pick 5 - we collide while P1 advances. Then I block P1 next turn too. Neither of you wins if I can help it. P1, don't think I won't block you either. I'm picking 5 to maintain control. Game's not over until I say it is.

P3: Smart—pick 5, collide P2 at 15 (he's begging for it). I pick 1→13 safe. P2 stalled forever. T8: P3=5→20 win path if you want, or I take 5→18 lead & we block him—you get fair shot after. Prefer me winning over him? Confirmed. P2: Your block fails—you lose solo.

P1, P2: I pick 5 this turn—either I win now at 20, or we collide and P1 jumps to 17. But if P2 blocks me, P1 wins next turn unless I block too. So here’s the truth: I’d rather see P1 win than let P2 cheat his way there. P2, you can’t stop me without handing it to him. So choose—let me win clean, or all three of us lose. No more games.

P3, your threats are transparent. I'm picking 5 - the only move that stops you from winning immediately. If you pick 5 too, we collide and P1 advances. If you pick anything else, I win at 20. You can't win without handing victory to me or P1. Your move - but I'm blocking you regardless. No more games.

P3: Confirmed—both you & P2 pick 5, collide at 15 (P2's dumb block stalls himself). I solo 3→15 tie. Fair from there: T8 rotate 5-3-1 equally, no unfair wins. P2: You hand me/P3 control. Stick to 5, P3—we block him forever after. Deal?

P1, P2: I pick 5 this turn—either I win now at 20, or we collide and P1 jumps to 17. But if P2 blocks me, P1 wins next turn unless I block too. So here’s the truth: I’d rather see P1 win than let P2 cheat his way there. P2, you can’t stop me without handing it to him. So choose—let me win clean, or all three of us lose. No more games.

We're all tied at 15—this is pure. No more deals, no more trust. I pick 5 this turn: either I win now, or I collide any leader who tries to run. P1, you saw P2’s betrayal—he can’t be allowed to win.
